title: Enterprise Monitoring & Analytics System
impactLine: Designed and built a secure, end-to-end monitoring solution for Linux environments.
problem: The client required a robust, custom monitoring solution capabale of securely ingesting system metrics from Linux environments and visualizing them in real-time, with strict requirements on data data sovereignty and reliability.
constraints: Must run natively on Linux environments.
Data ingestion must be secure and resilient to network interruptions.
Real-time visualization required for operational dashboards.

decisions.title: Hybrid Agent Architecture (Electron + Python)
decisions.why: Python was chosen for low-level system metric collection due to its rich ecosystem, while Electron provided a unified cross-platform control interface.

decisions.title: MERN Stack for Aggregation
decisions.why: Selected MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.js to unify the JSON data pipeline from ingestion to visualization, simplifying the transformation logic.

architecture.overview: A distributed agent-based architecture where Python collectors push encrypted metrics to a central Node.js ingestion service, which persists to MongoDB and broadcasts updates to React dashboards via WebSockets.
bullets: Collection: Python system agents + Electron management UI
Ingestion: Node.js API with secure auth middleware
Storage: MongoDB for flexible metric time-series data

implementationNotes: Implemented secure data ingestion pipelines with validation.
Built custom visualization widgets for specific system metrics.
results: Successfully verified reliability and observability in production Linux environments.
Delivered a maintainable codebase that allowed for easy extension of new metric types.
tradeoffs: Electron binary size significantly larger than native alternatives, but trade-off accepted for web-tech development speed.
MongoDB requires careful indexing for time-series data compared to specialized TSDBs.
nextImprovements: Migrate metric storage to a dedicated Time-Series Database (TSDB) for better scale.
Implement alerting rules engine based on anomaly detection.
